name: Premier Inn Belfast Titanic Quarter & City Airport

reviews.text: friendly check in very helpful.
reviews.title: brilliant from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms lovely and immaculate.
reviews.title: Very clean, very modern, fantastic value for money !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant staff young and so enthusiastic when serving really delightful couldnt have done more.
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.text: We were attending concert at Odessey Arena which is right next to Inn so perfect location
reviews.title: Family Friendly modern clean hotel at a great price

reviews.text: I am genuinely very pleased with my first Premier Inn experience. Although both my girlfriend & I live in Belfast we thought it be a good idea to have a relaxing night in the city to mark our three year anniversary together.
reviews.title: HITS THE HIGH STANDARDS EVERYTIME

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for four nights while I was in Northern Ireland on business. Normally we stay at The La Mon just outside the city (also very good), but they wanted a ridiculous price for the same period. We took advantage of the £29 per night deal and were not disappointed. During our stay we found the staff extremely helpful and efficient and a special mention must go to the restaurant staff who went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed the meals and restaurant facilities.
reviews.title: Excellent service and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried the £22 dinner and breakfast deal a couple of times and found it really good value for money, thoroughly recommended, especially as a pint of Guiness was also included!
reviews.title: The usual Premier Inn experience

reviews.text: The parking is the only bugbear, my company were footing the bill so it didn't damage my budget too much. Although £6 for overnight parking may seem a bit steep to some. If parking, remember to get your ticket validated at reception before you leave each morning (before 10 am) or the charge goes from steep to ridiculous!
reviews.title: Ideal for visiting the Odyssey Arena

reviews.text: All in all a thoroughly enjoyable stay in a nice, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel with professional and helpful staff. When I'm next over in Belfast on business I'll definitely try there first.
reviews.title: Perfect location for early Belfast City Airport flight

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel to go to an event at a nearby venue. We have stayed at various Premier Inn hotels before and we were not disappointed with this one. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself was very clean and modern. Although the hotel was booked out and there were a lot of people around, there was not even the sound of doors closing heard from the room. A great night away. We also had a first class meal and breakfast. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: good location however service appalling - disturbed sleep both nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel for concert at Odyssey. Checked in early and got car parking space - it is small and it's first come first served. Staff are really excellent - well trained and genuinely helpful and friendly. It's quiet - great nights sleep. Beautiful views from our very comfortable room. Breakfast was fine - we timed it well! Only disappointment was below average meal in restaurant - would not eat here again but would definitely use the hotel again. Really well done to all the staff - you are exceptional.
reviews.title: Superb value for money

reviews.text: Excellent hotel with staff that take a pleasure in helping. Spotless & quiet rooms. Only fly in the ointment is the pay and display car park that can rack up quite a bill if used a lot but then the hotel is in a large city center location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I am away on business frequently and tend to stay in Premier Inns when working away from home. I find Premier Inns to be cost effective while giving a resonable level of service. This Premier Inn was new to me and, in my opinion, is worth considering if you are in Belfast either on holiday or on business.
reviews.title: A view of the Titanic Quarter

reviews.text: I booked a few months in advance and was able to obtain a very reasonable rate. Having visted Belfast many times since the mid 1980's I was looking forward to a view of the city from the hotel but unfortunately, I was allotted a room on the first level Room 1**. Next time I will ask for a room on the upper floors.
reviews.title: great hotel, great location we will definately visit again

reviews.text: When arriving at the hotel, turn left into the road between the hotel and Odyssey Arena. You will be faced with two sets of barriers. Take the right hand barrier and park in front of the hotel. Total of £ 6 for the night which is OK.
reviews.title: Outstanding accomadation and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You need to book a couple of weeks in advance to get this special rate. New hotel. Spotless and the staff were just great.....very warm friendly yet efficent and professional. Breakfast good value at £7.99 for all you can eat. Food was plentiful and tasty. There is a small carpark and you will be charged £6 per night. You can walk to the city centre-staff are very helpful with information. There is the Welcome Centre in Belfast itself which can give you up to the minute details on tours etc. Taxi fare back from Victoria Strret in City under £6 .
reviews.title: Great value at £29 per night per room , cant be beaten for value!

reviews.text: group of 20 ladies went to celebrate forthcoming wedding (hen). Exceptional value for money £29 per room. The welcome we got when we arrived and the service provided was exceptional. I would recommend this hotel to all. ( age group 22-55). definitely return
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in the up and coming Titanic area of Belfast this hotel is a good location for Belfast city centre. It is next to the Odyssey arena and Pavillion which hosts pop concerts and also has a good range of bars, restaurants, niteclubs and cinema.
reviews.title: Good value for money hotel

reviews.text: We stayed on the 6th floor of the hotel and had a great view of Belfast city and were also overlooking the River Lagan.
reviews.title: An excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in to the hotel was easy, we used a check-in terminal in reception to pay and allocate us with a room number and key. There is lots of information in reception about what to do in Belfast and there is also an information terminal which has everything you need to know about Belfast. A vending machine is also located in reception for any crisps and snacks you need for your room.
reviews.title: Average hotel with hidden costs in a place with nothing to do.

aka: Premier Inn Belfast Titanic Quarter & City Airport Hotel
description: Ideally situated on the gateway of the titanic quarter of Belfast. Our hotel is also located across from the fantastic Odyssey arena and pavilion. Also within easy access of the George Best City Airport and with Belfast city centre only a stone's throw away, it is ideal for both business and leisure guests. Our Belfast Titanic Quarter Premier Inn has everything you'd expect, incredibly comfy beds in every room and an onsite restaurant.
